Size and Scale.name: 体型与尺寸
Size and Scale.description:
Size & Scale

Characters and creatures have a Size ranging from −4 for very small beings up to Size 20 and higher for massive behemoths. Specific creature Sizes are listed in their statistics, and explained on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型表]{体型表 }.

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型表]{体型表 } lists seven different “Scales,” from Tiny to Gargantuan, and the Scale Modifier that goes with each.

When creatures of different Scales attack each other, the smaller creature adds the difference between its Scale and its target to its attacks. A Tiny fairy (−6 Scale modifier), for example, adds +10 to hurl a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } at a Huge dragon (+4).

The larger creature subtracts the difference from its attacks. A Very Small eagle (−4) subtracts 2 from its Fighting totals when attacking a Tiny fairy (−6).

Scale Modifiers
Modifier Scale & Examples
-6 Tiny： Armor join, baseball, mouse
-4 Very Small： Human hand or 头部, basketball, house cat
-2 Small： Human limb, bobcat
— Normal： Human, motorc­ycle, bull, horse
+2 Large： Hippo, most vehicles
+4 Huge： Dragon, whale
+6 Gargantuan： Building, kaiju, ship

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 } & Target Size

Use the Scale of the target when making @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 } against creatures, not their Scale. If a hero wants to blast the eye of a Huge robot destroying the city, for example, use the Scale of the eye, not the robot. If the eye is about the size of a car, the hero adds +2 to his roll because a car is Large, a +2 bonus.

Hitting the vital areas have extra effects listed under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }.

Skill Specialization.name: 技能专精
Skill Specialization.description:
Skill Specialization

Savage Worlds skills are intended to be broad, allowing characters to focus primarily on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } for customization rather than multiple iterations of something like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } for edged weapons, Fighting for blunt weapons, etc.

If it’s important to have more detail for some reason, the GM can decide some skills require specialization. A character chooses one particular use of that skill to roll normally, and subtracts 2 from the total when using it in any other way.

Gaining an additional specialization counts as raising a skill below its linked @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{属性 }. So a character can gain two new specializations with an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }, or mix and match to gain a specialization and increase a skill below its linked Attribute.

Below are skills appropriate for this extra detail and some example specializations：

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾船]: Powered, Sail, Steam.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]: Hover, Tracked, Wheeled.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]: Axe, Blunt Weapon, Exotic (such as nunchaku; each is separate), Long Blade, Pole Arm, Short Blade.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.航空]{航空 }: Fixed Wing, Rotary, Space.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骑乘]{骑乘 }: Camel, Horse, Dragon.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }: Biology, Chemistry, Engineering.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }: Bows, Pistol, Rifle, Shotgun.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 }: Arctic, Desert, Temperate.

Sleep.name: 睡眠
Sleep.description:
Sleep

Most people need a minimum of six hours’ sleep out of every 24. A character who goes without must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{投骰 } at a cumulative −2 every 24 hours thereafter (to a maximum penalty of −4) or suffer @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }. A large amount of coffee, soda, or other stimulant adds +2 to the roll.

Snapfire.name: 猝射
Snapfire.description:
猝射

诸如重型狙击步枪这类特定武器，若是不使用其瞄具、瞄准镜、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.两脚架/三脚架]{两脚架或是三脚架 }而是抵在腰间进行射击，则准头就会大幅下降。如果角色在以猝射武器开火的轮内进行移动，则@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }会遭受-2减值。

Soak Rolls.name: 化解投骰
Soak Rolls.description:
化解投骰

在投出了伤害，但应用损伤之前，角色可以使用1点@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 }进行一次“化解”投骰。这是一次@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 }检定，每次成功和优良都能减少该次攻击造成的1个@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }。

若角色化解掉了单次攻击造成的所有损伤，则其同时还能移除动摇状态(即使来源是之前的)。进行化解投骰时不需要计算角色将要遭受的损伤减值—􍄔因为此时损伤还没产生。

角色只能就每次攻击进行一次化解。但若是对活力检定不满意，可以如常使用助力点重投。

动摇：角色可以使用1点助力点立刻移除动摇，这在任意时刻都能进行。

Social Conflict.name: 社交冲突
Social Conflict.description:
Social Conflict

Not every conflict is won by the blade. Successful oratory can topple nations.

When to Use These 规则： Most social exchanges are a simple skill roll resisted by the appropriate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } vs. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 }. For longer interactions, such as the back and forth of a long argument, negotiation, or a legal proceeding, the following system adds some drama and structure to each side’s discussion. (The GM might use a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.剧情任务]{剧情任务 } instead if the argument must be won in a hurry!)

The Basics： Characters make arguments back and forth over three rounds, roll their appropriate skills, then consult the Conflict Results table (below) to see how well they’ve influenced their audience.

Conflict Rounds

The conflict is broken down into three rounds of conversation, each focusing on a particular point (or a few highly connected points).

During each round, the player roleplays her character’s argument and makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } roll opposed by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 } of whoever she’s trying to convince. If a rival argues against her, the roll is opposed by his Persuasion instead.

Each success and raise by the petitioner grants her an “Influence Token” (rivals don’t gain tokens, they just oppose the petitioner and keep her from gaining them).

Modifiers：@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } rolls should be modi­fied by the situation as the GM sees fit. A hero trying to convince a scientist of a fact within his field rolls the lowest of his Persuasion or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }. A particularly brilliant argument or impassioned roleplaying might add +1 to +4. An insult or faux pas inflicts a similar penalty.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } should also be considered. Convincing a jury that an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.异客]{异客 } (主要) is innocent of a crime, for example, carries a −2 penalty.

Results

At the end of the third round, the speaker looks up her total Influence Tokens on the Social Conflict Results table below.

Trials： Run trials and similar conflicts from the accuser’s point of view since they must usually prove the accused’s guilt. If the player characters are the defenders, they oppose the prosecution and must keep them from gaining Influence Tokens with the judge (baron, king, warlord, etc.).

Accusers in a trial must get at least three tokens to convict. Lesser or greater results indicate the degree of punishment based on the setting’s customs and laws.

Social Conflict Results
Tokens Results
0 Pleas are denied and negotiations fail. Discussions may reopen if new information is presented or favors are performed. In a trial, the defendant is acquitted.
1-3 The target isn’t truly convinced, but provides the minimum amount of support possible. In a trial, the defendant receives the minimum penalty.
4-5 The arbiter is reasonably convinced or willing to help. He grants the aid requested, more or less, but only under certain conditions or in exchange for payment, tasks, favors, etc. The prosecution is successful with typical sentencing in a trial.
6+ The target is eager to help or agree. He gives more than expected in a negotiation or provides more support than requested. A defendant is convicted with the maximum penalty.

Example: To Arms!

Red must convince a baron to send troops to the defense of a neighboring fiefdom. The barony has warred with his neighbor for generations so the GM decides that’s a −4 penalty to Red’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } rolls.

Worse, she’s opposed by his slimy wizard, who argues against the idea every round (he opposes her Persuasion rolls).

Red gets lucky the first round and gets a success and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 }. That’s two Influence Tokens. She fails on the second, but gets one more in the third.

That’s three tokens in total. The baron agrees but requires payment in land from his neighbor in return for sending part of his army to his rival’s defense.

Special Ability (Aquatic).name: 特殊能力 (水栖)
Special Ability (Aquatic).description:
Aquatic

The creature is native to the water. It is a natural swimmer and cannot drown. Its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } in water is specified after the Aquatic ability.

Special Ability (Armor).name: 特殊能力 (护甲)
Special Ability (Armor).description:
护甲

A creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 } is written in parentheses next to its total @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }, and already added in. Thick, leathery hide generally offers 2 points of Armor. Creatures like a stegosaurus generally have 4 or more points of protection. Supernatural creatures may have much higher Armor values. A living statue, for example, might have 8 points of Armor or more.

Special Ability (Breath Weapons).name: 特殊能力 (吐息武器)
Special Ability (Breath Weapons).description:
Breath Weapons

Dragons and other “fire breathers” use a Cone Template for their attacks (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }). Breath attacks may be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.回避]{规避 }.

Unless the creature’s description says otherwise, breath attacks take the creature’s entire turn — they can’t perform @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 } in the same round they make a breath attack.

Special Ability (Burrow).name: 特殊能力 (遁地)
Special Ability (Burrow).description:
Burrow

From massive worms to sand-dwelling humanoids, many creatures are able to burrow beneath the earth and move within it.

Burrowers can tunnel underground and reappear elsewhere for devastating surprise attacks against their foes. The distance a creature can burrow on its turn is written immediately after its Burrow ability.

A burrowing creature may tunnel on its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }, and may erupt from the ground at any point within its burrowing @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } in the same turn. It cannot be attacked while beneath the earth unless the attacker has some special means of detecting it and penetrating the intervening dirt.

Burrowing creatures erupt from beneath their opponents and may take them by surprise. If the target was unaware of the burrower’s presence, the creature makes an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 } roll versus the victim’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 }. If the burrower wins, the target is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } to it only. With a raise, the burrower gets @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇袭]{奇袭 }. Targets on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机 } may attempt to interrupt the attack before it occurs.

Burrowers can’t usually surprise a foe once their presence is known, but can still burrow for protection and mobility.

Special Ability (Construct).name: 特殊能力 (构装体)
Special Ability (Construct).description:
Construct

Robots, golems, and other animated objects are collectively called “constructs.” Some are sentient beings while others are mere automatons following the will of their masters.

Whatever their origin or material, constructs have several inherent advantages over creatures of flesh and blood.

Constructs add +2 when attempting to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, don’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{失血 }, and Wounds are removed with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.修理]{修理 } instead of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 } with no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{“Golden Hour.” }

Special Ability (Elemental).name: 特殊能力 (元素)
Special Ability (Elemental).description:
Elemental

Air, earth, fire, and water form the basis of the elemental realms, wherein dwell strange, unfathomable creatures.

Elementals have bodies of pure earth, water, air, or fire and thus ignore additional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, can only be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{治疗 } via magic or natural healing.

Special Ability (Environmental Resistanc.name: 特殊能力 (环境抗力)
Special Ability (Environmental Resistanc.description:
Environmental Resistance

The creature is resistant (but not immune) to a particular type of energy or substance, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, iron, etc.

Damage from the source is reduced by 4, and the being adds +4 to resist matching @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } or powers with a similar @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }.

Special Ability (Environmental Weakness).name: 特殊能力 (环境弱点)
Special Ability (Environmental Weakness).description:
Environmental Weakness

The creature is susceptible to a particular type of energy or substance, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, iron, etc.

Damage from the source is increased by 4, and the being subtracts 4 when resisting matching @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } or powers with a similar @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }.

Special Ability (Ethereal).name: 特殊能力 (灵态)
Special Ability (Ethereal).description:
Ethereal

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.鬼魂]{鬼魂 }, shadows, will-o’-the-wisps, and similar intangible creatures have no form in the physical world (or can turn it on and off at will). They can pass through physical objects, cannot be harmed by non-magical attacks, and cannot even be seen unless they desire to be. Ethereal creatures are affected by magical items, weapons, and supernatural powers.

Unless its description says otherwise, ethereal creatures can throw objects, wield weapons, or even push terrified heroes down long, dark stairs.

Special Ability (Fear).name: 特殊能力 (恐惧)
Special Ability (Fear).description:
Fear

Particularly frightening monsters cause @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } checks to all who see them. Some truly terrifying monsters may inflict penalties on Fear checks as well. A creature with Fear −2, for instance, causes those who see it to make their Fear checks at −2. See the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } rules for effects.

Special Ability (Fearless).name: 特殊能力 (无畏)
Special Ability (Fearless).description:
Fearless

Mindless creatures, some undead, robots, and the like don’t suffer from the weaknesses of the mortal mind. Fearless creatures are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } effects and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }. They may still be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 }, however (usually because it draws their attention rather than causing emotional distress).

Special Ability (Flight).description:
Flight

The creature can fly at the listed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }. It uses its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } to maneuver in chases or other situations.
Special Ability (Flight).name: 特殊能力 (飞行)

Special Ability (Gargantuan).description:
Gargantuan

Gargantuan creatures are those that are at least @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 }12 or higher. Classic movie monsters like Godzilla fall into this category.

Gargantuans have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具注释]{重护甲 }, can take three additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }, and their attacks count as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.重武器 (HW)]{重武器 }.

Stomp： A Gargantuan creature may stomp by using an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果盖板 } (the size of the template is determined by the GM based on the monster’s “footprint”). The attack ignores @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 } modifiers and is an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } vs @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 } roll (defenders roll individually). Those who can’t get out of the way are stomped for damage equal to the thing’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } damage.
Special Ability (Gargantuan).name: 特殊能力 (巨型)

Special Ability (Hardy).description:
Hardy

Very tough or determined creatures do not fall from lesser injuries, no matter how many they suffer. A decisive blow is needed to put one of these tenacious creatures down.

If the beast is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, another Shaken result doesn’t cause a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }.
Special Ability (Hardy).name: 特殊能力 (顽强)

Special Ability (Immunity).name: 特殊能力 (免疫)
Special Ability (Immunity).description:
Immunity

Creatures born in fire aren’t affected by @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, and a horror made of pure lightning won’t suffer from a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } attack with an electrical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }. Immunities are to specific types of attacks, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.火焰]{火焰 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }, electricity, and so on. Such creatures don’t have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特殊能力 (无敌)]{无敌 }, they just ignore @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{伤害 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } results from the specific attack types named.

Special Ability (Infection).name: 特殊能力 (感染)
Special Ability (Infection).description:
Infection

A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.吸血鬼]{吸血鬼 }’s bite, a horrid @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.巨蜘蛛]{蜘蛛 }-like creature that injects eggs into its victim’s skin, or even the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }-born scratching of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.集群]{老鼠 } are all examples of Infection.

A character @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } by a creature with Infection must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll. Modifiers to the roll are listed in the creature’s description, as are the effects of failure.

Special Ability (Infravision).name: 特殊能力 (红外感应)
Special Ability (Infravision).description:
Infravision

Nocturnal beasts often see in the infrared spectrum—meaning they can “see” by detecting heat. Creatures with Infravision halve penalties for bad lighting when attacking targets that radiate warmth (including invisible foes).

Clever characters may figure out ways to mask their heat from such creatures. Smearing cold mud over one’s body or wearing special heat-filtering suits generally obscures the target from those with Infravision.

Humanoids with Infravision usually have normal sight as well.

Special Ability (Invulnerability).name: 特殊能力 (无敌)
Special Ability (Invulnerability).description:
Invulnerability

Some Savage Tales feature invulnerable horrors that can only be defeated by discovering their weakness.

Invulnerable creatures ignore damage as listed in their description. Unless otherwise specified, they can be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } but not @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } by other forms of damage. An ancient dark god given life by misguided cultists, for example, might only be vulnerable to shards of stained glass gathered from a church.

Special Ability (Low Light Vision).name: 特殊能力 (微光视觉)
Special Ability (Low Light Vision).description:
Low Light Vision

Low Light Vision ignores penalties for Dim and Dark @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 } (but not Pitch Darkness).

Special Ability (Paralysis).name: 特殊能力 (麻痹)
Special Ability (Paralysis).description:
Paralysis

Paralyzing poisons are covered under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }. Other creatures might paralyze their victims with magic, electricity, or other sources. Victims who suffer damage or a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } result from such a creature must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll or be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }. They’re also paralyzed and incapable of any action—even speech—for 2d6 rounds (or longer if otherwise specified).

Special Ability (Poison).description:
Poison

Snakes, spiders, and other creatures inject @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{有毒 } venom via bite or scratch. To do so, the thing must cause at least a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } result to the victim, who then makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll modified by the strength of the poison (listed in parentheses after the creature’s Poison ability). Effects of failure are described in more detail in the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } section.
Special Ability (Poison).name: 特殊能力 (毒素)

Special Ability (Regeneration).description:
Regeneration

Legend has it that @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.巨魔]{巨魔 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.吸血鬼]{吸血鬼 }, and certain other types of legendary creatures can Regenerate damage caused to them.

Regeneration comes in two types: Fast and Slow.

  • FAST: Wounded creatures make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll every round—even after they’ve been @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }. A success heals one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } (or removes Incapacitated status), and a raise heals an additional Wound. Wounds caused by some types of damage, listed in the creature’s description, do not regenerate but may still @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恢复]{治疗 } naturally. Trolls cannot regenerate Wounds caused by flame, for example.
  • SLOW: The creature makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恢复]{自然恢复投骰 } once per day.
Special Ability (Regeneration).name: 特殊能力 (再生)

Special Ability (Resilient or Very Resil.name: 特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧)
Special Ability (Resilient or Very Resil.description:
Resilient/Very Resilient

Elite @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 } are tougher than usual. This might include specially bred @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.兽人]{兽人 } in a fantasy setting, particularly tough thugs or agents in the modern world, or even mutant animals created in the lab of some mad scientist.

Resilient Extras can take one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } before they’re @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }, Very Resilient Extras can take two. Wild Cards can’t be Resilient or Very Resilient. The abilities exist to bring select Extras a little closer to the heroes and villains who lead them.

Special Ability (Size).name: 特殊能力 (体型)
Special Ability (Size).description:
体型

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 } grants a bonus to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 } (or penalty for small creatures) and is a guide to the typical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } of creatures in that general range.

Size is generally based on mass, but exceptions exist for extremely large but weak creatures, small but strong beings, etc.

Scale Modifiers are explained under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型&尺寸 }.

Additional Wounds： Large creatures can take an additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }, Huge can take two, and Gargantuan three. The maximum @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalty is always three. This stacks with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧)]{特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧) }.

Such creatures typically have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 } equal to the additional Wounds granted by Size.

Special Ability (Tentacles).name: 特殊能力 (触手)
Special Ability (Tentacles).description:
Tentacles

The creature has a number of “tentacle actions” specified in its description (usually 2 or 4). Tentacle actions collectively count as one of a creature’s three potential actions for the turn. The actions must stem from the tentacle in some way—usually a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 } attack, but this is the GM’s call.

If the creature is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }, it rolls its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{不羁骰 }with each tentacle action as usual.

If the being performs other actions on its turn, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 } or casting a spell, these and the tentacle actions are affected by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 } penalty as usual.

Grappling rolls made with tentacles get a +2 bonus, and “crushing” causes the creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } in damage unless otherwise listed.

Severing a tentacle is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }. If damage exceeds the creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }, the limb is severed and the monster is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }. If it was already Shaken, it takes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }.

Special Ability (Undead).description:
Undead

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.行尸]{丧尸 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.骷髅]{骷髅 }, and similar physical horrors are particularly difficult to destroy. Below are the benefits of being such an abomination.

  • Add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 } rolls to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, ignore addi­tional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, don’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{失血 }, and can only be healed with magical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 }.
Special Ability (Undead).name: 特殊能力 (不死族)

Special Ability (Weakness).name: 特殊能力 (弱点)
Special Ability (Weakness).description:
Weakness

Some creatures suffer additional damage or can only be hurt by their Weakness. A creature made of ice, for example, might take double damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.火焰]{火焰 }. See the creature’s description for particular effects.

Speed.name: 速度
Speed.description:
Speed

Characters occasionally need to attack fast-moving targets. If the relative speed between attacker and defender is 60 Miles per Hour (MPH) or more, apply the Relative Speed Penalty：

Relative Speed Penalty
Penalty Target's Relative Speed Is...
-1 60 MPH+
-2 120 MPH+
-4 240 MPH+
-6 Mach 1+
-8 Mach 2+
-10 Near Light Speed+
  • Multiply MPH by 1.5 to get @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }
  • Divide @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } by 1.5 to get MPH

Stunned.name: 震慑
Stunned.description:
Stunned

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.电击枪]{电击枪 }, creature abilities, the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.震慑]{震慑 } power, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触电]{触电 } hazards, or other shocks to the brain or nervous system make a character essentially helpless until they manage to shake it off.

Stunned Characters

  • Are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 } (this is removed at the end of the victim's next turn as usual)
  • Are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } (this remains until they recover from being Stunned)
  • Fall @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.卧地]{卧地 } (or to their knees, GM’s call)
  • Can’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 } or take any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }
  • Don’t count toward the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.围攻]{围攻 } bonus

Recovery： At the start of a Stunned character’s turn, he makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll as a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 }. Success means he’s no longer Stunned but remains @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } until the end of his next turn. With a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 }, his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } state goes away at the end of this turn.

Submachine Guns Table.description:
冲锋枪

每样武器都标有典型的弹匣容量。额外弹匣能以武器费用的10%购入，每个装填满的弹匣重1磅。
类别 射程 伤害 穿甲 射速 弹容量 最低力量 重量 费用
@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.H&K MP5]{H&K MP5 (9mm)} 12/24/48 2d6 1 3 30 d6 10 300
@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.汤普森冲锋枪]{汤普森冲锋枪 } 12/24/48 2d6+1 1 3 20 d6 13 350
注：汤普森冲锋枪能使用50发的弹鼓，这会让其重量增加2磅，而且每个弹鼓的费用为$50。
 
@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.Uzi]{Uzi (9mm) } 12/24/48 2d6 1 3 32 d4 9 300
Submachine Guns Table.name: 冲锋枪表

Suppresive Fire.name: 压制火力
Suppresive Fire.description:
压制火力

Suppressive Fire turns a firearm or other rapid-firing weapon into @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }. It trades accuracy for a hail of ammo to keep the enemies’ heads down.

A weapon must be able to fire at least as rapidly as a revolver and can’t require reloading in between shots.

Suppressive Fire uses three times the usual number of bullets for its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } and always incurs @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 } regardless of the weapon’s original @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } (the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.激情四射]{激情四射 } Edge, bipods, and tripods negate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 } as usual).

To make the attack, the shooter places a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{中型爆散盖板 } on the tabletop and makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll (a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } die regardless of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }—RoF comes into Maximum Casualties, below.) Figure @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 }, etc., as usual, to the center of the template.

Next compare the total to each target in the template and consider any modifiers that apply to each (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 }, the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.闪避]{闪避 } Edge, the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.偏斜]{偏斜 } power, etc.). Success means the target is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 }, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } means he’s actually hit (no bonus @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } is possible from Suppressive Fire).

Maximum Casualties： Every target under the template can be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 }, but it can only cause @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } to a number of targets equal to the weapon’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }. The attacker chooses which targets are hit among his possible choices.

Example: Gabe fires a minigun at a group of rampaging insectoids. He places a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{中型爆散盖板 } over five of them and rolls his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } die and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{不羁骰 }. He has the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.激情四射]{激情四射 } Edge so he ignores @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 } but still subtracts 2 from his total for Medium Range. He ends up with a 9 on his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll.

Two of the insectoids were behind a large rock and get Medium @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 }. That subtracts 4 from the total so that’s a single success—they’re @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 }.

Three of the targets were out in the open so they’re hit with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 }. Gabe can hit up to five given his weapon’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }, so all three take @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }.

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } of 5 means each “shot” is 40 bullets, multiplied by three for Suppressive Fire. That’s 120 bullets, which is why miniguns come loaded with lots of ammo!

Surprise.name: 突袭
Surprise.description:
Surprise

Combat often starts before everyone involved is prepared. An ambush, a sudden double-cross, or a trap might all give one side in a fight an edge over the other.

When this happens, the ambushers are automatically on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机 }. Deal them in as usual anyway in case one of them gets a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{鬼牌 }.

The victims of the attack make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 } roll (if they haven’t already, perhaps from ambushers sneaking up on them). Those who make it are dealt in as usual. Those who fail get no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{行动卡 } and can’t act in the first round of combat.

Test.name: 考验
Test.description:
Test

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.援助]{援助 } option allows a character to help out her allies. Test is the opposite—it lets him make things more difficult for his foes! Tests include embarrassing an opponent, throwing sand in his eyes, staring him down with a steely gaze, or anything else a clever player can think of to rattle his enemy and put him off-balance.

To perform a Test, the player describes the action and works with the GM to determine the most appropriate skill to roll for it. Tests are resisted instinctively, so the “attacker’s” @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能投骰 } is opposed by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{属性 } it’s linked to. Tripping someone is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll versus @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 } since that’s what @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } is linked to. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 } is linked to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 }, so verbally humiliating someone is resisted by that @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{属性 }. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }, when used as a Test instead of an actual attack, isn’t compared to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 }—it’s opposed by @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }.

If the attacker wins the opposed roll, he can choose to make his foe @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神或脆弱 }. If he wins with a raise, the target is also @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } or there may be other subjective effects as the GM allows, such as a tripped foe being knocked prone.

Modifiers: The GM must determine which modifiers apply to a Test. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }, for example, should include @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 }, etc. A hero with a bonus to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } does not add it to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 } when challenged with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } roll, however, because the defender resists with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }—not his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 }.

Take the details into consideration as well—using @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 } to hit a rival’s ego where it hurts, for example, might be worth a +2 bonus to the attacker.

Repetition： Using the same or similar action repeatedly quickly grows less effective, so the GM should apply a steep penalty if a character’s Tests become repetitive (or disallow it entirely).

Additional Dice： If characters have addi­tional dice for a Test, such as when using a weapon with a high @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }, he may roll all the dice but takes only the highest as his Test total. He doesn’t get multiple results and he can’t spread them out to other targets.

The Drop.description:
奇袭

有时候攻击方能趁着敌人措手不及之际对其构成“奇袭”。由GM来决定这会在什么时候生效—�通常会是对象遭到束缚或是完全没意识到攻击。奇袭通常只针对近战，但GM也能酌情在其他情境中予以准许(狙击手对毫无觉知且静止不动的目标进行攻击)。

奇袭会在一个@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }内让角色对该目标的攻击和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }投骰+4。

昏厥打击：若是角色在遭到攻击方奇袭时所受的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }足以造成@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或更糟糕的情况，其必须成功通过一次@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 }投骰(若此攻击指向头部则还要-2)，否则就会被打到失去意识。

昏厥角色会在半小时后或是直至GM认为就剧情而已恰如其分的时点苏醒。注意，昏厥攻击并非只有打击头部，这可以是任何种类的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }。
The Drop.name: 奇袭

Thirst.description:
Thirst

An average-sized human requires two quarts of water a day. This requirement is doubled in very dry conditions (such as the desert) or areas of heat and high humidity (the jungle) as the character perspires constantly and begins to dehydrate.

If enough water isn’t available, the hero begins to suffer from dehydration. A day after he can’t get enough water, he must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{投骰 } every eight hours (every four hours in a very hot or humid environment). Subtract 2 if he has less than half the water he needs in that period, and −4 if he has no water at all. Failure incurs a level of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } means he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{力竭 }.

See the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 } skill when a character wants to search for water from the local environment.

Recovery: Characters recover Fatigue levels normally after receiving sufficient water.

Death: An individual @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{无力化 } by thirst perishes after 2d6 hours.
Thirst.name: 干渴

Three-Round Burst.name: 三连发
Three-Round Burst.description:
三连发

一些军用武器只需要扣动一次扳机就能迅速连续射出三枚子弹。如果武器具备该特质，则其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }在该模式下是1，但能一次性射出3发子弹，同时@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }投骰+1。

Touch Attack.name: 接触攻击
Touch Attack.description:
Touch Attack

A character who simply wants to touch a foe (usually to deliver a magical effect of some kind) may add +2 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } roll.

Trait Rolls.name: 特性投骰
Trait Rolls.description:
特性投骰

进行技能或属性“检定”或“投骰”的时候，投对应的骰子即可。若结果大于等于4(“目标值”，TN)，行动即算成功。举例而言，角色@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 }是d6，投1枚六面骰，结果是4或以上时即是成功。

调整值：环境会为投骰带来调整值，比如射击远处的东西或是寻找藏得很好的线索之类。某些情况有着标准调整值，比如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{远程攻击 }。对于更为主观的任务——譬如察觉伏击或隔门偷听谈话—􍄔则需要由GM来决定调整值是多少。

一般而言，像是泥地追踪这样的简单任务，调整值是+2；藉由火把发现踪迹这样的困难任务，调整值是-2；在暴雨中追踪这种特别困难的任务，调整值是-4。

复数骰：当角色投骰多枚骰子(比如用机枪射击时)每枚骰子独立计算。

不羁骰

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 }进行@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰时只投一枚骰子，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }则可以额外多投一枚d6，其与特性骰结果二者取高。两种骰子都能绝佳(见下)。

每动作一不羁骰：当@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }在一个动作中投多枚骰子时(比如用机枪射击)，其也只投1枚不羁骰。

这枚不羁骰可以替换一枚@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }骰，也可以被忽略掉——其不会给投骰增加动作或是攻击。

例子：具备@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.连击]{连击 }专长的加布进行近战攻击时除不羁骰之外还能额外投一枚格斗骰，由于不羁骰只能用来取代其中一枚骰子，而非增加一次攻击，所以只有两枚骰子能生效。

绝佳

《狂野世界》内所有@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰和伤害投骰都上不封顶。这意味着在一枚骰子出最大值时(d6是6，d8是8等等)，该枚骰子可以再投一次并加到总值当中—􍄔这称为"绝佳"。任何投骰带有的调整值都应当在绝佳投骰相加完成后再加以计算。

例子：红尝试跳过一处危险的冰川裂口。她是具备d8@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }，因此她投1枚d8和1枚d6并取高。这次她两枚骰子都绝佳了(d8出8，d6出6)。她再投d8出了4，因此总值是12；她再投d6又出了6，接着投出了2——最后总值是14。红轻松地跳过裂口...至少这次是这样！

优良

有时候搞清楚@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰成功到什么程度颇为重要。每超过目标值4点就被称作一次“优良”。如果人物只需要4就能射中对手而投出了11，则命中的同时获得一次优良(投出12则是两次优良)。在结算完所有调整值后计算优良。

单次优良总能提供某种额外效果，比如攻击时的奖励伤害，或由GM决定的其它好处。

对抗投骰

有时投骰会遭到对手的"对抗"，攻击方得出@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰总值后，防守方则要尝试加以抵御。

技能或属性是否需要对抗在对应情况下都会有所阐明，或者由GM决定怎样做才是最为合理。举例而言，若是两名角色尝试从对方手中抢过某物，那么可以进行@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 }对抗投骰。潜行绕过某人是用@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 }投骰来对抗@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 }(这在潜行技能的说明中有所阐述)。

主动方角色在对抗投骰中必须首先得出自己@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰的最终总值(包括使用任何@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 })，并且必须至少达到基础成功(TN 4)，否则就会失败。防守方再进行投骰，其结果必须大于等于先前那名角色的结果，否则就是攻击方胜出。

得胜方使用对手的总值来判断优良效果。

大失败

当@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }进行@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰时的技能骰和不羁骰都出1时会触发大失败。这次尝试自动失败，而且发生了糟糕的事情—􍄔武器脱手或故障，误伤友军，载具撞毁，法术失手(见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.启动]{反冲 })等等。

大失败不能重投，哪怕使用@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 }也不行。

龙套和大失败：若@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 }的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰出1并且判定是否为大失败颇为重要——诸如施法投d6出1——这就是一次大失败，否则这只会是一次普通失败。

复数骰：某些能力允许角色投多枚@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }骰，譬如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.连击]{连击 }专长或用1以上的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }进行武器射击。复数骰的大失败会在多于半数的骰子自然出1时触发。若角色为@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }，则不羁骰必须也要出1才会触发。

例子：加布用高科技悬浮自动加农炮轰炸。其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }是3，因此投3枚@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }技能骰和1枚不羁骰。若是三枚或以上的骰子(包括不羁骰)出1，则触发大失败。

未受训尝试

若是角色不具备所尝试行动的技能，则投一枚d4作为技能骰(@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }还有不羁骰)，并在总值中-2。

GM有权决定特定任务无法进行未受训尝试，比如执行复杂的外科手术或开喷气式飞机。

重投

某些@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }或能力允许角色重投@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }(只要不是大失败)，若要这样做，再次重投所有骰子并获得一个新总值。你可以保留其中产生的任一总值，因此只要重投不为大失败，事情就不会更糟。出现大失败会立刻终止所有重投并且其会成为该次尝试的结果—􍄔这就是挑战极限所需承受的风险！

从不同的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 }或其它能力而来的多次重投能力可以同时生效。

团体投骰

当需要为拥有类似特性的一帮@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 }进行@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }投骰时，可以如常投一枚特性骰以及一枚不羁骰并将其作为这个团体的结果。这使得团体能得出一个较为平均的结果，而无需单独给每名个体进行投骰。

例子：一队士兵想要躲过加布的传感器。 GM投他们的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 }骰(d6)和1枚不羁骰，然后两者取高以得出士兵们的总值。

Traits.name: 特性
Traits.description:
特性

角色因其“特性”而得以成型，属性和技能根据骰子类型划分高低，d6属于平均水平，在此之上的骰子类型则代表能力更为优秀。

属性主要是用于抵抗诸如恐惧或超自然攻击这类效果的被动或内生能力.技能用于主动行事或是影响他人。

尽管偶有例外，但上述两个概念之间在根本上有所区别。

属性

属性不会直接影响技能投骰。《狂野世界》把学到的知识和训练所得视作最为重要且直接的要素。高属性能让人物得以更快地提升技能，解锁更多可选专长，后者能让两名具备相同技能的角色各有千秋。

所有角色初始时以下五个属性各自都是d4。

灵巧(灵巧)：衡量角色的灵活性，敏捷程度以及整体协调。

聪慧(聪慧)：衡量角色的先天智力，心智灵活程度以及脑子转得有多快，常用于抵抗特定类别的心智和社交攻击。

心魂(心魂)：自信、决心以及意志力，这常用于抵抗社交、超自然攻击以及恐惧。

力量(Strength)：身体力量以及健壮程度，同时这也是人物在近身战斗中的伤害基准，以及用来决定穿戴与携带东西的多寡。

活力(Vigor)：代表角色对于疾病、毒药以及毒素的忍受力和抗性，以及在倒下前能承受多少物理伤害，这通常用于抵抗疲乏效果，同时也是衍生数据中坚韧的基准。

使用属性

属性用于：

  • 在@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }时决定技能的提升速度。
  • 解锁@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }限制。
  • 得出诸如坚韧或是近战伤害等@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{衍生数据 }。
  • 抵抗效果(诸如遭到@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 }、反制法术、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }这类社交攻击)。

技能

人物在角色创建时有12点可用于购置技能的点数。小于关联属性(在技能名称旁边以括号标出)的技能提升起来比大于等于关键属性的技能更为便宜。参照@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色创建概要]{角色创建 }以及@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }。

核心技能会以红星标记，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{玩家角色 }的这些技能初始都是d4。

角色可以尝试自身并不具备的技能，但这会难上加难，见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{未受训尝试 }。

该版本狂野世界的技能变化

以下是该版本《狂野世界》中最为重要的技能变化总结。

核心技能

每名角色以下五个基础技能初始都是d4：运动、通用知识、察觉、交涉以及潜行。d4并不意味着其擅长这些技能，只是在此之上有一点基础经验而已。

主要变化：

  • 从游戏中移除魅力。
  • 攀爬合并进@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }当中。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.通用知识]{通用知识 }现在由聪慧投骰变成单独的技能。
  • 探查现在更名为@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.调查]{调查 }以让其意思和用途更加清晰。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.集中]{集中 }成为@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (异禀)]{奥法背景 (异禀) }的新技能。
  • 知识在大多数设定里被分拆成各个技能，尤其是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.人文]{人文 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.作战]{作战 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.电子学]{电子学 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骇客]{骇客 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.语言]{语言 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.神秘学]{神秘学 }以及@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }。
  • 开锁现在是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.贼活]{贼活 }技能的一部分，后者同样能处理扒窃、巧手、开保险箱及其他盗贼技艺。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.表演]{表演 }现在是新技能。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.修理]{修理 }及其用途定义得更为明晰。
  • 市井门道现在归入@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }。
  • 游泳由@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }处理。
  • 投掷囊括在了@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }之中。
  • 追踪纳入@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 }之中。

创造其他技能

GM能创造自己想要或是设定需要的任何技能。若技能对用途有所定义，则应该致力于明确其如何运作。举例而言，如果你的星际冒险战役内星际航行占了一大部分，同时你认为使用航天系统不在电子学技能的范围内，那么你也许会新增一项航天学。

玩家同样能在得到GM许可的前提下新增自己的特色技能。然而，除非玩家主动找方法加以运用，否则这在大部分设定中可能都无法经常亮相。

例子： Deadlands: Hell on Earth里，角色必须要团结整个镇子以对抗正在接近的变种群落。艾米莉有一个自己创造的技能：新闻学。她决定通过该技能去写一篇动人的文章并将其印刷出来给镇子里的每个人阅读。她获得了优良，因而GM决定让整个镇子都团结在守护者一侧。

技能理念

新玩家有时会更重视诸如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }这些较为宽泛的技能，同时尝试让其他所有技能也是如此。但技能系统的初衷是创造并体现角色本身。无论是狙击手或是弓兵，射手在许多设定里面都稀松平常，而且全都使用同一个能力——精确地用武器射击。在塑造这些角色时不需要同时给火器和弓矢各留一个技能。

然而，调查型角色的确需要许多不同的技能，因为他们处事方式各有不同。强硬的侦探在街头打听时需要@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }；社交名流混迹于上流社会；书虫则会钻入图书馆内；而计算机极客会使用@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骇客]{骇客 }去取得想要的东西。

同时，一些技能合并起来并不合理。举例而言，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾船]{驾船 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]{驾驶 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.航空]{航空 }可以合并成“载具”技能，但当代不是每个会开车的人都能开飞机。这点在调整战役中的技能时要有所考虑。


综合调整值

先前版本的《狂野世界》里为诸如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 }和追踪(现已整合进@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 })列出了一大票调整值。在该版本里，为了让GM能以更主观的立场放眼全局，着眼于那些无法统合在表格里的东西，我们移除了这些表格，让GM自己分配加值和减值，这通常在-4到+4之间。

这能让GM更综合地考虑所有因素，尤其是有所重复的部分(比如都影响视野的雨水和黑暗就不该叠加)，并简单快速地进行加总，而不用在紧要关头中跑去翻查表格。



熟悉度

如果通过展示角色不熟悉某一技能的特定用法能达到恰如其分的戏剧效果(诸如捡起一把外星武器并尝试通过@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }以其进行攻击)，那么GM就应该在总值上应用减值(通常是-2到-4)。

这样做时的减值大小完全取决于状况而定。举例而言，枪手在使用弓箭时可能会遭受减值，至少直到其花上一两天进行练习为止。如果玩家特别声明其教授角色是世界闻名的化学家，那么在GM要求他进行与古生代地理学相关的检定时，其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }投骰可能会-4。(尽管如此，若是玩家能扮演出知识匮乏，这也是奖励助力点的好时机！

反复使用下的减值持续时间则取决于实际技能。物理上的减值在经过1天或之类的练习后可能就会消失，而基于知识的技能则减值只有在角色能获取合适资料且花时间研究对应主题后才会消失，举例而言，尽管角色主修法国文学，但倘若有时间学习莎士比亚，那就不应在@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.人文]{人文 }上遭受减值。

总而言之，熟悉度减值应该用于戏剧性效果，或是展示文化或科技水平的差别。即使如此，也应该保持故事流畅推进，不要纠结于细枝末节。

Trappings.name: 特效
Trappings.description:
Trappings

Trappings allow the core @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } presented in this chapter to have many different appearances. They usually have no game effect on their own, but are important for atmosphere and theme.

One character might fire a swarm of bees to attack her foes, for example, while another shoots red lasers from her eyes. Both are examples of the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } power and share the same mechanics, but they look and are described differently.

Trappings do matter when an obstacle or opponent has a particular strength or weakness. If an ice troll suffers +4 damage from fire- or heat-based attacks, for example, a blast a player describes as a fireball counts as a fire attack and does +4 damage.

Once described, a power’s Trappings don’t change without the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.奇才]{奇才 } Edge, or an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }—see below.

A character can alter the power’s effects as she wishes using the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术调整]{奇术调整 }.

Synergy

Sometimes logic dictates a power’s Trapping should have some additional effect. Zapping someone with a lightning bolt while they’re standing in water should cause additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }, for example, or less if they’re wearing a rubber hazmat suit.

When this occurs, the GM can decide there’s synergy that either increases or decreases the effect or damage (GM’s call) by +2 or −2.

Oppositional forces, such as fire and ice or light and darkness, don’t have synergy against one another (though such effects are sometimes accounted for in some creatures’ @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.怪物图鉴]{特殊能力 }). If a fire @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.爆发]{爆发 } hits ice armor (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.防护]{防护 }), for example, there’s no synergy because they cancel each other out.

Limitations

Sometimes a power’s Trapping imposes a limitation on the power. This gives the power focus at the expense of versatility, reducing the strain it causes the caster.

The Limitation is permanent and always in effect unless changed with an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 } as noted below.

Each limitation placed upon the power reduces its total @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奇术点 } cost by one (to a minimum of 1). If this would reduce the cost to 0, you gain a +1 bonus (+2 maximum) to the arcane skill total instead.

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }: The power’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } is reduced to Touch (and its listed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } is greater).
  • PERSONAL: The power's @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } becomes Self (and has a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } of Touch or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } Limitation above).
  • ASPECT: The character can only access one aspect of a power (that has more than one choice), such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.滞缓/加速]{滞缓/加速 } or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.提升/降低特性]{提升/降低特性 }.

Adding & Changing Trappings

A character gets two new @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } when he takes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.新奇术]{新奇术 } Edge. He may instead add Trappings to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } in place of one or two of the new @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 }. A hero who takes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.新奇术]{新奇术 } Edge, for example, could choose one new power and add an ice Trapping to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 }.

The GM may also allow a player to change the trapping of existing power when she gains an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }. This should reflect a major change in the character in some way as determined by the player and GM.

More on Trappings

Trappings allow an endless variety of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } and the sources of those @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 }. Sometimes that might produce some st@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } results, so the player and GM must use common sense to figure out any inconsistencies. Here’s an example.

Gabe is an alchemist in a fantasy game. He decides his blast power manifests as a bag of small, explosive pots he hurls like grenades.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.爆发]{爆发 } has a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 } ×2. With a d8 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 }, that’s 16″ with no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } penalties. This is sometimes better than using Athletics to throw an actual grenade, which has @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } penalties at 10″ and 20.” That’s okay—Gabe’s player has to track and use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 }. Another character with traditional grenades doesn’t, but must contend with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } modifiers.

Travel.name: 旅行
Travel.description:
Travel

Many epic tales feature trips across great expanses. Adventurers might endure a long voyage across the endless seas of 50 Fathoms or ride the dusty trails of Deadlands: The Weird West.

Below are some guidelines to help you figure out how long these journeys take and what dramatic events might happen along the way.

When to Use These 规则： If it doesn’t matter how long the trip takes, skip all this. Narrate the journey, maybe do an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.幕间]{幕间 }, and get to the next scene. If you need to know how long the trip takes, or want to insert an obstacle or encounter of some sort, use the information below as a guideline.

The Basics： The mode of travel determines how many miles the group makes per day.

Travel Times

The rates below assume reasonable terrain and weather. Difficult conditions can drastically decrease progress (or increase it in the case of sailing with strong winds).

Average Travel Times
Transport Miles/8 Hour Day
Foot 24
Horse 30
Early Car 200
Modern Car 400
Sailing Ship* 30
Steam Ship* 40
Modern Passenger Train 400
Prop Plane 1,000
Commerical Jet 4,000

*Sailing ships (and steam ships to a lesser degree) are greatly affected by currents and winds. Strong winds or currents in the right direction allow them to travel about 60 miles per day. Poor winds or going against the current reduces them to 20 miles per day or less.

Encounters

If an area is dangerous or lawless, draw a card from the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{行动卡 } once per day (or even two or three times a day in particularly dangerous areas). A face card or higher represents an encounter, and the card suit can be used to determine the type.

Draw twice more if the card is a Joker and combine the results—such as Enemies and an Obstacle or Strangers and Treasure (defined below).

Game Masters are highly encouraged to customize encounters based on their setting.

  • SPADES—ENEMIES: Monsters, enemies, or hostile beasts bar the way. Perhaps they lie in ambush if it’s a popular path, waiting for the next band of unwary travelers.
  • HEARTS—STRANGERS: The group comes upon neutral or friendly nonplayer charac­ters such as merchants, lost travelers, a guide, or even other adventurers.
  • DIAMONDS—TREASURE: Somewhere along the way is something of value—the hulk of a crashed ship with some remaining supplies waiting to be scavenged, a cache of useful or valuable minerals, or a magic item for sale or guarded by someone or something.
  • CLUBS—OBSTACLE: The heroes encounter an obstacle of some kind and must figure out how to circumvent it. Some examples are a flooded river, minefields, a decaying rope bridge, whirlpool, etc. The obstacle might also be defended by creatures or enemies as well.

Example: Irradiated Wastes

Red and Gabe are wasteland warriors in Deadlands: Hell on Earth, traversing an area outside of Las Vegas, Nevada, that’s been blasted by nuclear “ghost rock” bombs.

The GM draws a Jack of Clubs and decides the area is now a maze of jagged “glass chasms” and toxic sinkholes. This slows progress to a crawl for two days and makes them both roll for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } from heat and radiation (see the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } section).

The GM draws again later that day and gets a Queen of Spades. From one of the sinkholes slithers a swarm of irradiated serpents, hungry for fresh prey.

Two Hands.name: 双手
Two Hands.description:
双手

双手武器单手使用时带有-4减值。角色能在@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }当中算上全部@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 }，但失去所有其他诸如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 }加值之类的好处。

Two Weapons.name: 双武器
Two Weapons.description:
Two Weapons

A character armed with two melee weapons adds +1 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } rolls if his foe has a single weapon or is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.手无寸铁]{无武装 }, and has no shield. It adds no bonus against creatures with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.天生武器]{天生武器 }.

Wielding two firearms offers no special advantage other than additional ammunition.

Characters who want to specialize further can take the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.左右连环]{左右连环 } or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.双枪小子]{双枪小子 } Edge.

Unarmed Defender.name: 手无寸铁
Unarmed Defender.description:
Unarmed Defender

It’s difficult to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } a blade with one’s bare hands. An attacker armed with a melee weapon adds +2 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } attacks if his foe has no weapon or shield. (This doesn’t stack with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇袭]{奇袭 }.)

Unarmored Hero.name: 无甲勇士
Unarmored Hero.description:
Unarmored Hero

Pulp action tales often feature heroes with little or no armor defeating far more heavily armored adversaries.

In these settings, if a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } chooses not to wear any@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 } (ignoring shields), he adds +2 bonus to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.化解投骰]{化解投骰 }!

Unstable Platform.name: 不稳平台
Unstable Platform.description:
Unstable Platform

A character attempting to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{火焰 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{投掷 } a ranged weapon from the back of a horse or other mount, a moving vehicle, or other “unstable platform” subtracts 2 from his total.

Vehicle Notes.name: 载具注释
Vehicle Notes.description:
载具

载具表中囊括了数种@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.地面载具]{陆行 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.飞行器表]{飞行 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.船舶表]{水行 }载具，其中包括诸如坦克和装甲车这类的军用载具。

  • 体型：载具的体型和尺寸是通过与人类对比而得出(见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型表]{体型表 })。载具正常在@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{毁坏 }前能承受三个@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }，但大型载具能额外承受一个损伤，超大型载具是两个，巨型则是三个。
  • 操控性：载具的响应性和机动性会给所有操作者的机动投骰(@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾船]{驾船 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]{驾驶 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.航空]{航空 })带来加值或减值，这从特别缓慢迟钝的-4到灵巧无比的+4不等。
  • 最高速度：：最高速度不是通过@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }来表述，而是英里/每小时(MPH)。这样更方便对应现实世界的载具并将其加入到游戏中。而且追逐规则里重要的是载具的相对速度，而不是实际速度(见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{追逐 })>

    要将英里/每小时转换至@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }，将MPH乘以1.5即可，要将角色和载具在桌面上的战斗中整合到一起则见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{桌面上的载具 }。

  • 坚韧：载具的基础耐久度包括其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 }值(在括号内)，在创造或构思没在本书中展示的载具时可将@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.地面载具]{地面载具 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.船舶表]{船舶 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.飞行器表]{飞行器 }列出的内容作为参考>

    以重护甲(坦克)来评估现实世界中的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 }值，首先基础+4，然后前10英寸内装甲每厚1英寸会+2，接下来到20英寸为止装甲每厚1英寸会+1，在此之后每厚2英寸(整数)+1。举例而言，装甲厚23英寸的坦克，其护甲值是(4+20+10+1)=35>

    根据诸如现代复合材料之类等其他因素对其进行调整。

  • 乘员：这是搭乘的操作人员以及可容纳的任何额外乘客的数量。比如“2+8”这类的标注，意味着其需要两名操作员，同时能搭乘最多八名额外乘客。
  • 费用：这是载具的平均价格。

载具注释

气囊与安全带：碰撞对配有载具安全装置的乘员只会造成一半伤害(向下取整)，更多细节见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{毁坏 }。

两栖：载具能进入水体而不会进水或瘫痪。其水中的移动速度见对应的单独描述。

反导弹防御机制(AMCM)：AMCM系统是电子干扰器、箔条和热诱弹等等，这让驾驶员回避导弹(见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.导弹表]{导弹 })的机动投骰+2。

四轮驱动(4WD)：将每英寸@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{困难地形 }视作1.5英寸，而不是2英寸。

重护甲：只有标注有@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.重武器 (HW)]{重武器 }的武器才能伤到这辆载具，不管其伤害投出了多少都是如此。这避免了走运时能一手枪打爆坦克。重护甲载具在与其它没有重护甲的障碍物(包括载具)碰撞时受到的伤害减半。

除非另有声明，这些载具在侧面及背后防护会较为薄弱。命中这些地方的攻击(GM判断)其武器伤害骰子增加一枚。比如说，3d8会变成4d8。

悬浮：这种载具属于悬浮类，因此能忽略大部分低矮地形障碍以及在水体上行进。

红外夜视：热成像装置针对散发热量的目标只受一半的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。

先前版本转换

下列的载具相较先前的版本在数值上稍有差异：

加速(Acc)：加速现在整合到了操控性和最高速度中。

攀越：攀越现在整合到了每个载具的操控性数值当中。

移速：先前版本中的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }乃是基于“桌面”的速度，而且比起该版本中的数值要低得多。若是要对现实载具进行转换，则查找其以MPH为单位的实际最高速度。对于虚构的载具，则将其旧的最高速度乘以3，以此得到现实世界中的最高速度(MPH)。

联装：同类型的武器可以通过双联装或是四联装来同时开火(三联装没有效果)，双联装武器在命中上+1，伤害上会+2。四联装武器命中+2，伤害+4。

例子：@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.飞行器表]{喷火MK2A战斗机 }(8×机炮，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 }3)中的飞行员的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }是d8，机翼两边的射击投骰各自是3d8，射击投骰总值+2，命中的子弹造成的伤害再+4。

夜视：只要有一定的环境光源，各种车载夜视仪系统都能免除昏暗和黑暗的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。

应敌火力：这些武器在追逐中有特殊能力，见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{追逐 }。

倾斜装甲：倾斜装甲能将炮弹从外壳偏斜开来。对抗该载具的直射弹道攻击(诸如@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.地面载具]{坦克炮 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.火箭发射器与鱼雷表]{巴祖卡火箭筒 })会遭受-2的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }减值。

航天器：该载具能在外太空使用。注有大气层的载具也能进出行星大气层。

稳定器：稳定器连接的任何武器其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不稳平台]{不稳平台 }减值都会得到下降(通常是坦克或装甲车的主炮)。稳定器能将该减值下降到-1，而高级稳定器则能到0。

隐形涂层：吸收雷达波的黑色涂层能让载具更难被传感器发现，发现或锁定这些目标的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.电子学]{电子学 }投骰-4。

履带：有履带的载具能爬过大部分诸如圆木或矮石等低矮障碍物，同时能碾过积雪、泥巴和其他滑溜表面。忽略@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{困难地形 }的移动减值。

武器：具有武器的载具会注明其武器所在以便游戏叙述以及判断@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{追逐 }规则，以下是最常见的几种：

  • 固定：该载具武器只能向列出的方向开火(通常是前后45度角左右)。
  • 同轴：可以向列出方向180度角开火的凸出架台武器，如果其架设在炮塔上，则只能向炮塔每回合面向的方向开火。
  • 转塔：转塔上的武器可以360度转向开火。

Vehicles.name: 载具
Vehicles.description:
Vehicles

Sample lists of vehicles (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.飞行器表]{飞行器 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.地面载具]{地面载具 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.船舶表]{船舶 }) are included in Chapter Two (Gear) along with any relevant @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具注释] .

Vehicular weapons work just like any other—characters make @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } rolls to hit a target and roll damage if successful (plus a bonus die if they hit with a raise). Unless a character has the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.手稳]{手稳 } Edge, don’t forget the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不稳平台]{不稳平台 } penalty.

Damage and how to handle vehicles on the tabletop are covered under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{追逐与载具 }.
